It's a short game with puzzles that are too easy sometimes, but the rewarding story and interesting mechanics make it a fun game to spend a couple days with. Absolutely fantastic but I just wanted more. Portal 2 here I come!

What can I say about Portal that wasn't already said? The game is great with it's puzzles, amazing with it secrets and story and forever challenging challenges. Portal is amazing, something that every person should at least try it once, play it twice and experience it forever. Not only does the game tie in with Half-Life but it also ties into the wonderful history of Valve.

Truly a classic and a masterpiece to this day. Short but very sweet and unforgettable.
Portal é um jogo rápido e fácil, tem uma história boa e usa a engine da Valve, mesma do Half Life 2, bem singular o sistema dos portais e da manipulação da I.A no personagem. Recomendo!

Seriously, if you are looking at reviews, just play this already. Puzzle mechanic is fun and intuitive. Challenging enough without being frustrating, and GlaDOS is just the best character, even not including the stuff you learn about her in Portal 2. Despite being a very old game, it very much holds up today. Quality is quality, and the simple style masks the game's age very well.

I legitimately cannot think of someone I would not recommend this game to. Except maybe a person with a recent head injury that easily gets motion sickness.
A mecânica do jogo é muito boa, porém é um jogo muito curto. Dependendo da sua play, você consegue zerar o jogo em 40 minutos. Mas, no geral, o jogo é daora, e quase sempre tem promoção na Steam.

Even years after its initial release the game is still kicking.. And it is still Alive... You will get what this means once you reach the end... It is really a good 3-5 hours depending on your pace. Cannot commend on the additional maps as I have done those. But the main game, is a bit of a challenge. Good puzzles, good story (yes there is one) but you get there in the end. Enjoy and have fun! Got it on discount and was worth it!

Portal came out well over 10 years ago. It was a big deal at the time. I never played it. Since then I have played many games that reference jokes and rooms from Portal, so they longer I left it, the less I felt the need to play it. But this weekend I was in the mood, so gave it a shot.

The story is, you wake up in a test chamber, and a disembodied voice makes you do puzzles or die. Eventually you break out. The boss fight at the end sucks, like all boss fights. I'm not a big fan of the overall level design either, because it feels like you're railroaded down one particular solution, even after you escape the test chambers. It feels contrived that you can't just open a portal wherever, you have to do it on the magic spot the level designers intended, usually in an awkward position where you need to repeat the same platforming bit over and over. But despite the annoying puzzles and platforming sections, the story is neat. The script and voice acting of the antagonists is truly masterful. Worth a buy when it's on sale since it's an important piece of gaming history, but don't expect too much playing it today after Stanley Parable and the like.

One of my favorite Puzzle games. Valve really did well on it and while some of the puzzles are very frustrating or reaction time heavy, it is fairly fun and enjoyable to come back to, regardless of how outdated the graphics and the storytelling is compared to modern standards.

It goes without saying. Portal and Portal 2 are absolute classics, so much so that Portal 2 won "Ultimate Game of the Year". I grew up with both games on the PS3, and I f*cking love them. I read up somewhere about someone who was giving their opinion on which of the 2 Portal's were better. What didn't surprise me is that he couldn't choose, but he did say something that I completely agree with. "Portal 2 is a better game, but Portal is a better work of art".

Loved the puzzles and the story. I just got this today and I played a whole 6 hours straight and already got 8 of the 15 achievements. Some of the puzzles can be challenging, but you just got to think outside the box. Or rather, think with portals. 10/10, great game!
